intro: Ricinocarpus strictus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its upright, slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by berries that turn red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
